overview_info.Subject:
Das Anthropobiology gehört zum Studienbereiche Biology der Fächergruppe Mathematics, Natural Sciences.Weitere Informationen zum Studienbereich Biology.Weitere Informationen zur Fächergruppe Mathematics, Natural Sciences.
                                                Anthropobiology
overview_info.Areas of Concentration: Molecular Genetics, Pharmacogenetics and Population Genetics, Bioarchaeometry, Human Genetics, Population Biology, Primatology

Target group: The MSc course in Anthropology is a research-oriented degree course, the central theme of which is Biological Anthropology with a focus on Evolution and Diversity. The core question of Anthropology is the diversity of humans, their ancestors and related species in space and time. We are interested in the entire divergence of primates from origin to recent species. Another specialisation is Human Population Biology in prehistoric times. In the research and teaching focus of Primatology, Paleoanthropology and Population Genetics, current molecular genetic and biostatistical methods are imparted theoretically and experimentally. Archaeometric techniques and scientific archaeological methods are also taught in the degree course. The technical closeness to human medicine and human genetics, which focus on clinically relevant diversity, is reflected in the course as is genome research and bioinformatics.
Annotation of the Higher Education Insti: Commencement of studies in winter semester recommended.If the Bachelor degree certificate is not available by the application deadline, but at least 135 credit points can be demonstrated: Submit a certificate of study and examinations and the average grade achieved so far. (This certificate must be issued by the relevant higher education, original or officially authenticated copy). If the degree was obtained abroad: officially authenticated copy of a certificate of recognition (responsible: Student Service - Admission International).After enrolment, the diploma must be submitted.

language_requirements: Area of study: Biology, Computer Science, Mathematics

Target group: The aim of the masters programme Applied Bioinformatics is to prepare bachelors graduates in the field of food science to apply bioinformatical methods in research and industry. To achieve this, students gain expertise in understanding the latest research in bioinformatics and applying this to real-world problems.

deadlines_info.Bewerbungsfrist EU-Ausländer:
Bewerber/innen, die im Ausland ihre Hochschulzugangsberechtigung (z.B. Abitur) erworben haben, sollten ihre Zeugnisse so früh wie möglich über den Studierendenservice - Zulassung International (www.uni-mainz.de/incoming) anerkennen lassen. Der Antrag auf Anerkennung sollte spätestens sechs bis acht Wochen vor der jeweiligen Bewerbungsfrist gestellt werden, da die Anerkennungsurkunde der Bewerbung beigefügt werden muss. Bewerber/innen mit ausländischen Zeugnissen bietet die JGU studienvorbereitende Deutschkurse bzw. das Studienkolleg zur Vorbereitung auf die Feststellungsprüfung an (Bewerbungsfristen siehe www.studium.uni-mainz.de/bewerbungsfristen).
In Studiengängen mit Eignungsprüfung endet die Bewerbungsfrist bereits am 15.05.2020. Beachten Sie zudem die noch früher liegenden Anmeldefristen zur Eignungsprüfung in den jeweiligen Fächern.

Annotation of the Higher Education Insti: The course combines Business and Economic subjects with a non-European foreign language (Arabic, Japanese or Chinese) as well as Business English. It is based on the solid foundation of necessary knowledge of the economic, social and social structures of the respective target region, which is deepened by a one-year practical study phase in the country of the chosen language (two integrated practical semesters).

Required ECTS credits: 210


                    For this degree programme, you should have gained your first university qualification in one of the following subjects groups or areas of study:
                    
Subject group: Economic Sciences, Law

                                                Nursing Science

Annotation of the Higher Education Insti: There are two course structures:Course of study IIntegrated in training (9 semesters): parallel to vocational training as a nurse or health and pediatric nurse or geriatric nurse Course of study IIAfter completing 3 years of nursing training, a 5-semester course is completed in block phases (semesters 1 and 2 being studied part-time).

Annotation of the Higher Education Insti: The course supplements the skills acquired in vocational training and leads to an extended science-based nursing expertise. Registered nurses can shorten the course length to four semesters by means of a crediting procedure.
